text: Grabbed a quick snack here.  Crab cakes are tasty.  Ambience is ok, very clean.  Staff is friendly.

My husband and I had dinner at The Grill last night, and have to say that we weren't too pleased. Since we arrived early around 5PM, the dining area was still practically empty. We ordered the calamari to start (tasted great, no complaints), and ordered dinner shortly after (this is when things went downhill). I ordered the lamb chops, and my husband ordered the steak salad. Our dinner took much longer than expected to arrive (we noticed multiple people arriving after us who were already paying their bills). We didn't mention anything, but our waitress also noticed the delay and was very proactive about it. When she went back to the kitchen, they informed her that they had gotten my husband's order wrong and had to redo it. Our waitress was extremely sweet and offered us a free dessert to make up for the delay. I really didn't mind the wait; the real disappointment occurred after the food arrived. My lamb chops had been burnt to a crisp. After I scraped away all of the char, there wasn't much left to eat. I really was hoping that the meal would've been worth the wait, but that wasn't the case. In the end, I left feeling hungry and disappointed.  No complaints about the service (our waitress was amazing), but I can't say the same about the chef. As this is a high-end restaurant with good reviews, I'm assuming we just ran into some bad luck with the chef, who may have been having an off-night. The free dessert was a delicious plus though!

My wife and I were in town to see the play Hamilton. Decided to give it a shot on a friend's recommendation. I ordered the double cut lamb chop medium rare and my wife ordered the filet medium well. When they came out mine was medium well and hers medium rare. By now you're probably wondering why I gave them five stars. When we told them there was a mixup they did everything but backflips to make us happy. They brought us new entrées which were both absolutely perfect. I will definitely be back next time I'm in Chicago. Pricey...... Yes. Worth every penny...... Absolutely.

The Grill on the Alley is a very nice and very pricey. Don't be fooled by the outside exterior because we were! From the look on the outside your thinking that this will be just another downtown watering hole...Nope! It is a very fancy high end steak house, (some may argue that it is not just a steak house). The food is very good and the portions are very filling. You may have take home if your into that. We ordered the NewYork Steak, the Braised Short Ribs and a side of Loaded Mac & Cheese. Both meals were very tasty.  The restaurant is very spacious and has a very open feel to it. The Bar area is also very lively. You will not feel like you are right next to other guests. The service is above average and the servers are not overbearing. I would recommend if you are not making a reservation before arriving that you dine during the week for dinner. It seems as if it could get crowded after 6  pm on the weekend. On a Wednesday night there was a bit of a crowd. Also, I would recommend that you come dressed to impress. Most of the men were dressed in suits and the women are dressed to impress as well.  bon appétit!
The Grill's drinks and food are spot on. That probably a good reason so many professional sports teams stay here.  Brick Chicken, Pizza ,Steak,Spinach and Artichoke dip are great gotos!!

Inside/connected to the Westin hotel, we found this restaurant to be very convenient after a long day of traveling.  Food is a little pricey, but thank God for a bar menu (that you can have either in the restaurant or the bar area).  My daughter and I had the fish taco, which were good. The rest of the family had the crab cakes bits/sandwiches was told that it was good as well. We also had 1 small order of wings that I really enjoy (very crispy), had a really nice flavor--Dinner was over $200 for 4 people (including 2 drinks, no dessert) again pricey and we had breakfast the next morning, 2 omelets and 2 eggs benedict and this came to over $100 which is outrageous, so for that reason, I'm giving 3 stars.

We arrived in Chicago this evening, and after a very long day we decided to just have a nice meal at The Grill which is located in the lobby of the Westin. Our server was exceptional and took great care of us. We started with the sashimi tuna as an appetizer and it was a nice start. I thought it was unusual that the tuna steak was seared on the edges, but it was still very good. They should really reduce the amount of ginger on the plate and double the delicious cucumber ribbons that came with the appetizer. They were refreshing and a great addition to the tuna. We then decided to split a bowl of lobster bisque which still left us with large individual portions. It was very good- probably the best we have had in awhile. My husband had the 14oz filet and it was nice. It could have used some butter or some type of sauce, but overall was well executed. For my main dish I had the lobster salad. The portion was perfect. The salad was loaded with lobster, tomatoes, cheese, walnuts and other goodies. The salad dressing lacked flavor. I think a vinaigrette would have been a better choice. My husband had the frangelico cappuccino which he really enjoyed. I do appreciate our server when it came to my wine selection. I initially had the corvo pinot grigio which was ok. I decided to try a glass of the match book chard next, and I didn't really like it. Our server asked if I did, and I mentioned that it wasn't my favorite but would finish the glass since I ordered it. He was nice enough to insist to swap it out for the pinot I was drinking previously. It was very nice! It was great service.

This restaurant at the Westin Hotel has a very stately appearance. We were greeted and seated in a beautiful dining room of dark woods and artwork covered walls. We began our meal with lobster bisque and steak tartar. Both were excellent! The bread that accompanied the meal was a very nicely crusted sour dough.  I ordered the filet of Dover sole. It was a generous portion pan fried in brown butter and seasoned perfectly. My dining partner ordered the crab cakes. They served two croquettes of nicely seasoned crab. A very nice sauce accompanied the dish. We also ordered skin-on mashed potatoes. They were hearty and well seasoned. The second side dish we ordered were the brussel sprouts. The brussel sprouts included carrots, pecans, celery and turnips. Way too much going on in this dish. We finished the meal with an excellent key lime pie and a six grape port.

I work across the street and  been here numerous times and the food has always been yummy. The waiter, Steve, however, is a standout wonderful person and fantastic at his job. Complete sweetheart and very kind, courteous, and funny. Whenever I go in, I always hope he's there and that I get him as my server.

We had bigger ambitions to have lunch outside the hotel as we were in town for a friends wedding.  However timing and convenience won out.  We sat at the bar at The Grill for lunch.  We ordered the spinach artichoke app which was good but took a REALLY long time so defeated the purpose.  I ordered the filet quesadilla which I expected to be very good considering we were in a steak house....the steak was def not filet and had very little flavor.  My husband had the California turkey sandwich- I can never understand why sandwiches are built so they you can't get your mouth around them?!?
This steak is out of this world!! The cowboy with Blu cheese is excellent. I would definitely bring my parents back

So, this place is associated with a hotel (The Westin) and I've found that most such restaurants leave something to be desired.  This one is the same... it is like they don't try as hard to offer good service or thoughtfully prepared food. I have stayed at this hotel a few times and usually end up eating here at least once due to the convenience.  I must say... if you're into brussel sprouts - their brussels are great!

Impromptu, I took 175 of my clients, colleagues and partners to the bar for drinks and apps and we had a fabulous time! For five hours we tested the skills of the bartenders and kitchen staff and they did amazingly well.  This Restaurant & it's  bar is close to the John Hancock building, small groups would run over and then up, enjoy that 92nd(?) floor stunning view and come back to celebrate with the rest of the group - almost like having an amusement ride at the party. A very upscale, traditional steakhouse feel (gee, I wonder why????!) made for a nice business group venue.  Staff was great with the short notice, too.  Side note - This was the first time I've ever covered an open bar tab for a group this size for 5 hour- First, kudos to everyone living in Chicago for not popping in for a "free drink", Second, I really thought more people would go for the "good stuff"- they didn't, or if did they certainly didn't know what the "good stuff" was,  Third - a hat tip to the bar's fair prices, it wasn't near as expensive as my boss was thinking it would be (!)... Cheers to Chicago!

Tonight's Chicago-style pizza at the Grill was less than spectacular, probably because my waiter let it sit too long and get cold. (I ate it anyway because I didn't want to wait another 20 minutes for another and because, hey, pizza.) So I guess this review is more about the service than the food. It was a not-so-busy Wednesday night, too, with lots of empty tables.

In from out of town and this seemed like a good choice for lunch. I would absolutely recommend this restaurant. Great service to start. Our waiter recommended a great drink ruby red lemon drop and it was delicious. So is their fresh squeezed lemon aid. Next we he recommended their chicken lime salad. It was very good. Very filling which was good since for a salad it's pricey. My daughter had their hamburger. She ordered it medium rare and it was closer to well which normally would be disappointing but it was still delicious. Her fries were perfectly seasoned and the bread and butter as odd as it sounds was delicious as well. I would definitely go again.

This restaurant is adjacent to our hotel, the Westin.  The food is excellent. Today we shared the Jumbo lump crab cakes and onion rings. The crab cakes were large and mostly crab. Not a lot of fillers, which is unusual. Very good. But the thing to really rave about is the onion rings. You know how with onion rings you take a bite and it pulls out the whole onion and you're left with just the breading? These were different! They use just the inside of the onion so when you bite it, you just get that bite. Everyone should make onion rings like that! Service was good too. We ate in the bar and had a very enjoyable time

The steaks we just had were good as one should expect for $50+ for a piece of meat ... but slightly over cooked ... but we did not want to make a deal out of it - and they were still really juicy and delicious. HOWEVER ... They sent us key lime pie and port and Fudge Brownie Pie to make up for it. The FUDGE BROWNIE PIE was so amazing it was ridiculous. I do not have a sweet tooth, but it was amazing. Also Octavio was a great waiter!

For some reason service was bad today. Sat at sidewalk. Took a long time before someone came to help. At end of meal I wanted something else and again it took forever for my server to come. Do not get the poblano quesadillas. They were gross. One big greasy mess with no flavor. How can they put something on the menu that tastes bad? The 5 dollar quesadillas at my local taqueria are way better.  I do love the lobster bisque. Tastes like liquidfied lobster. The key lime pie is excellent too. Probably one of the best.

This place is ok at best.  The food is average in a city with great restaurants......this is not one of them.  The steaks are slightly below average for Chicago.  The side dishes are good.   Service is average for a Michigan Ave restaurant. All in all, nothing to write home about....if you have other options, use them.

Probably the worst Westin restaurant in the world. It took over an hour to get our food, the service was lacking and the taste would have been better at Denny's. As a platinum SPG guest, very disappointed and definitely never coming back here. #WestinSucks

Went here for the first time today, was the very first table to be seated and yet, still waited almost 40 minutes for the food to come out. When I got my salmon burger and had requested sauce on the side, of course, it wasn't. A big glob was right smack in the center of my bun. In any case, the salmon burger was above average, approximately 7oz of fresh salmon. My wife had a regular burger which she thought was pretty good. Overall, The service could have been better and so could the lunch meals, but we did leave full and would consider going back again.
This is one of my favorite local bars. The food is phenomenal and the bar staff are true mixologists. Always a great time to be had there!!

The bartender needs to be replaced. The guy (with a beard), was terrible. Being a Starwood platinum member, I have had the opportunity to spend time at a lot of lobby restaurants and bars and this was quite bad when it came to bartender service - poor attitude, attentiveness and service time.  Went over to The Drake instead and had amazing service.

Amazing service! Heidi was awesome, very friendly and attentive. I ordered the Kobe burger and the chefs dessert. The food was good, but the service is what made the experience so enjoyable. Awesome job, hire more people like Heidi. Will definitely recommend this place to others.

Boy is it awkward to post a review on their breakfast when its clear that they're bread and butter is dinner fare. In any case, I've been on a a search for my favorite corned beef hash in the Chicagoland area. And I must saw, their take is... Interesting. Not your typical mashed up version of soggy meat and diced potatoes. This version is chopped and every piece of corned beef is quite juicy and tasty. Was a little salty, so the poached eggs and sourdough toast were good for balance. Price was what I'd expect from this type of place and service was great.  Giving a four star review just to stay neutral since the place is currently rated at 3.5.

Great food. We had the lump crab cake as an appetizer and it was wonderful. The lemon drop martini was the best I have ever had. I had the petite New York steak and it was cooked to perfection. Bridgett was our waitress and we appreciated her humor and suggestions for our meal. She is a great person to represent this restaurant.

We had a rehearsal dinner and cocktail party (great crab cakes appetizers) for 60 people here on August 21, 2015.  Everything was fabulous beginning with the managers Bob and Linda with their attention to detail on everything from the menu (which included 4/5 entrees for guests to select from that evening) to helping us decide on various space usage. The servers were very upbeat and pleasant!  The food was wonderful no matter what was chosen by each guest and the chocolate cake with raspberry sauce was a special hit!  I can't believe we had not been here before.....but would highly recommend for all the above and the fact that it was extremely reasonable!  (One thing to note - the entrance is really around the corner on Delaware).

My wife and I were looking forward to dining at the Grill on the Alley, Chicago and it was exceptional.  From the very, very personal, helpful, and extremely competent wait staff, i.e, Carlos who helped us on our first night and Julie who was the wait staff person for our second dinner, very much made our dining at the Grill a great success.    Between the two evenings we had  shrimp pomdora twice given it is truly outstanding, the halibut special, and final a Reuben sandwich we were constantly surprised at how good the food was and at really reasonable prices given the quality of the restaurant.  We simply cannot recommend The Grill highly enough and we hope you enjoy it  Larry

My family and I were staying at the Westin while in Chicago for a family wedding. We get in on a Wednesday afternoon and have a bog group come to this restaurant at 7 pm. There were barely any people in the place. The service was absolutely horrible. People at our table didn't get their food until the rest of us were finished. They didn't refill our drinks, would take them away and not bring them back. After nicely complaining all they offered was 1 free dessert for all 12 of us. The two people who's food came late was cold, and they had to eat while everyone else finished. I will never go to this restaurant ever again. If i could give it 0 stars i would.

I ate here with two regulars who live in the neighborhood and love both the food and the service. They could not stop talking about it and their impressions rang true as we ate and enjoyed the splendid camaraderie with the wait staff. I had a lunch special of Blackened Sea Scallop Salad, which is not on the menu, but was absolutely excellent. They had gazpacho soup which I regretted not ordering after the nonstop stream of superlative culinary descriptions that ensued. They also ordered a Caesar Salad and a Shrimp Cocktail that had shrimp so large that he was unable to finish it and took it home in a doggie box. We didn't get dessert but they both raved over the Chocolate Brownie that comes with ice cream and is HUGE. I would come back here without hesitation and give it my highest recommendation!
Good food, good service with prices you'd expect in a hotel restaurant. We've had breakfast, lunch and dinner there over the years and have always been satisfied.

Had a meeting at The Ritz Carlton and booked a dinner for a private group. Dennis N was a fabulous partner and I would come back just for him.  Food was great, service was great and most importantly I didn't have to worry not being able to be there. We WILL be back

We had a large party reservation for a birthday here. Upon entering our seating area the table setting was warm and inviting. Drinks were a bit pricy but tasty. I ordered the filet with sautéed spinach which was phenomenal. The Brussel sprouts were equally as good. The loaded Mac and cheese tasted as if it came out of the box.  The most disappointing aspect was the service towards the end of the meal. The staff seemed as if they were in a rush to get us out the door and bothered by our request to split checks.  The grill was OK at best. Can't say that I'd return unless someone else was footing the bill. The service really killed my impression of the restaurant.

It was Ok. Service great. Came for breakfast and i just think its more like a dinning place, te service was fine and fast, but the eggs and the pancake i could just have made better at my house. Th place is very nice and elegant but deff for evening and more elegant ocation.

I feel like not too many people actually go to this place even though I have only had good experiences here.  I tend to go for lunch so perhaps dinner time is busier.  For lunch they have a great menu selection and it is easy to get a table in which ever area of the dining room you want. The special salmon burger I had last time was delicious.  My only critique is that it is quite pricey.

Very pretentious, overpriced, and pushy with the recommendations. I think we got two or three suggestions every time the waiter came over. He seemed more concerned with what extra he could sell versus how we were doing.

Three stars here is about right. This place is nothing special, but does well at maintaining good service all while serving decent food. I'd recommend this place more so for a few drinks and a game; leave the food to somewhere down the street.

I went here for restaurant week with my best friend. The waitress was attentive to our needs and the service was good. We did the prefixe menu which was $44 dollars. The lobster bisque was good. I had the scallop and creamed spinach on the side and tres leches for desserts. My best friend had the same soup with cowboy ribeye with a side of mash potatoes along with the same desserts. We both got sick so we won't be going back to this restaurant.

My fiancé and I came here for Valentine's Day. We don't get the chance to head out very often and wanted something memorable. The steaks were cooked to perfection, the ambiance was sophisticated but not stuffy, and the service was fantastic. 5 stars - We'll definitely be back.

Overall, this place was a little bit of a let-down.  I'll start by saying the food was fantastic.  I had the lobster salad and a filet with truffle butter.  The lobster was fresh and the filet was cooked to perfection.  My review is solely based on the service we experienced. Everyone we encountered, from the bartenders, to the host, to the wait staff, was extremely frazzled. While it was Valentine's Day I realize you may expect everyone to be a little bit busier, but the staff didn't seem to know how to handle a packed house. After we were seated, we waited a good 20 minutes before we were acknowledged by our server. We didn't even get menus or water during that duration, which is completely unacceptable.  They did comp us a round of drinks and our everything else was brought out in a timely manner.  Prices are comparable to what you would find at similar restaurants.  But, the quality of service far exceeds this place.  For the price, I'd much rather go somewhere else, for the exact same meal, and better service.
Just outstanding!! One of those hidden gems you wouldn't really think about, but definitely worth a visit. If you can, try and do a private dining experience in their cellar. Really fun time!

We were looking for a nice steakhouse to end our trip to Chicago. The Grill was really solid! We both got filet, mine was a little better than my girlfriends. Hers was a little fatty and wasn't as tasty as mine. I felt bad but still enjoyed mine.  I got a wedge salad which was great! She had lobster bisque which was tasty but had no lobster which usually makes a bisque over the top. Our drinks were good. Our sides mashed potato and creamed spinach were very good.  The waitress was very nice and helpful. Overall really enjoyed the meal!

Tourist and locals alike enjoy this great steak house. I've been going there for years any experienced excellent service and food. The burger is the best gourmet burger I know about, long before gourmet burgers were fashionable.

My son was getting married at the Westin Water Place in Chicago.  Date was a Saturday in December.  Based on the weather in December of 2013, we looked to have a rehearsal dinner that was close by and could handle upwards of 60-65 people.  Grill in the Alley was recommended to us.  We went for dinner one night just to check out the ambiance and food.  We learned that GitA is "in" the Westin but is not a Westin property.  The steak and fish are outstanding especially the Dover Sole!  The decor is a warm and inviting white tablecloth "Chicago steakhouse" with lots of wood, wall art and intimate. Met with Dennis, the Special Events/Sales Manager, in July and began to plan for this big event. Dennis is the most personable, capable and accommodating venue manager that we have ever encountered.  He worked with us understanding and meeting all of our needs and fulfilled all of promises made to make this a very successful, fun and quality event.  Dennis worked with our budget, our choices, multiple changes and unique (at least to us) challenges. The dinner was held last Friday, 12/12. Everything, and I mean EVERYTHING, went as planned at every stage throughout the party and dinner.  Incredibly competent and friendly service staff complemented the wonderfully prepared food.  There was nothing but compliments concerning the food and service from all of the guests.  All of our friends noted that this was not a "banquet" but felt like a close, comfortable and 60 person "family dinner". Dennis, the chef and the staff made this the perfect night for our family and friends to celebrate the upcoming nuptials of our son and fiancee.  THANK YOU!!!! You have a special dinner or event to plan??  Go to Dennis and the Grill on the Alley for an unforgettable and wonderful experience!!

Last night I had a GREAT Thanksgiving Dinner at The Grill!!! I am somewhat a regular there and have never had a bad meal. I had the DOUBLE CUT PORK CHOP with the PORT WINE-BLACKBERRY reduction. I know what you are thinking, Pork Chop on Thanksgiving? YEP, when you try it you will see why. The Chop is on the "Chef's Menu" which is a single page and is presented along with the regular menu. In closing, make it to "The Grill" any time for a great meal with GREAT SERVICE. Plus the decor is BEAUTIFUL, there are Prints and Drawings of all sizes from various Artists and time periods hung SALON style on almost every wall. Be sure to ask a Staff Person about the MURAL on the South Wall of the Main Dining room.

Started off with the lobster salad which was good, only one decent size piece of lobster with small pieces strewn about. Found a great buy on the wine list, it was a Howell Mountain 2007 Cabernet for $112 which I thought was great. See picture. Kids got the Mac n cheese and cheeseburger sliders which were both good. For dinner my wife and I split the big filet which they split for us on two plates which was nice. Got the truffle butter on top and a side of creamed spinach and mushrooms. Shrooms were baby bells which were good but the spinach was cold and just decent. My father in law said that the lamb chops were the best he ever had. Only negative was that it was super expensive.

I've been lots of restaurants before and never ever leave a negative review. But this time I'm really upset. I ordered the scallop salad and all the scallops are overcooked. They are in a dark black hard cover and taste sour and awful... I asked for changing a new dish the attitude of the sever was good. but the new dish looks like they just wash the scallops and cut off the overcooked part and recook it again...

The oysters tasted so old and bad that I didn't finish them. That's never happened to me before.... I am obsessed with oysters and I would never leave an oyster unless it tasted really gross. They were so shelly I was worried I would get sick from eating so many little prices of shell! The oysters were so disappointing. It's weird bc they took so long to bring them out. They must have had no one in the kitchen with shucking experience. They reminded me of that one time I tried to shuck my own oysters: awful. My caesar salad was depressing: lettuce was brown and you could tell it was definitely not freshly cut. Dressing was not a catastrophe. Maybe even good. I just can't remember anything but those horrible oysters. The worst oysters I've ever had, hands down.  Our server was snobby at first and then creepily nice...  The best part was the bread and olive tapenade that they bring to the table. However, this is not a good enough reason to go back. My sister and I will probably not be trying this place again any time soon unfortunately.

What a fantastic place!  We were staying at the Westin for a bachelorette party and the Westin was horrible, even though The Grill is separate, they went above and beyond to accommodate our party!  Dennis, the event coordinator there was the best!  The service was impeccable and I cannot wait to go back!  Not to mention the food and drinks were delish!

Had a very respectable filet, and the decor / ambience, and service were all 4 to 5 star worthy. The only nits to pick here were the salad (Ceasar) was blah, and so was the dessert (chocolate cake). In this price point (very high), I realistically need all parts of the restaurant to be firing on all cylinders to rate it 4 or 5 stars - why sacrifice anything if you're paying top dollar? Anyway...very good steak, nice wine list, great service...I'd just suggest you be cautious about salad, and skip dessert.

Highly recommend working with Dennis in the catering/special events area.  He set up a wonderful reception/dinner for a client event 2 nights in a row.  Everyone that attended had a great time and the food was outstanding!  The chef and staff paid very close attention to all of my special requests and created a menu suitable for everyone attending.

A bit pricy and it's attached to a hotel (Westin) but this place has really good food and libations and I LOVE the ambience. I've dined here and also hosted planned and attended a corporate type dinner  and breakfast in their private room.  Service is top notch.  Their burgers are delish and huge.  I can barely eat 1/2 of one.  I had a fish special once and thought it was very fresh, good and portion size was adequate.   If you are over 40, bring readers because their menu can be hard to read!

We have eaten often at the Grill on the Alley in Beverly Hills and have always enjoyed the meals and the service there. Now we are working with Dennis, the events coordinator at the Grill on the Alley in Chicago for two events surrounding our daughter's wedding in October. We could not be more pleased with his service and suggestions for our events.  The restaurant is spacious and has smaller rooms for private parties and the decor is lively and fun.  Our dinner was very good too,  but the service really makes the experience extra special!

This was awesome! Salmon was amazing! The steak was one of the best we have ever had! Got the apple cobbler and the berry short cake for dessert both were to die for! Service was a little slow but the food was well worth the wait!

We ate here for our anniversary while on vacation. We were not sure what to expect and were hoping it wasn't just another "generic" steakhouse but we were pleasantly surprised. The wine menu was great and food was delicious. It is definitely worth a visit when you are in Chicago.
What a wonderful surprise this restaurant was to find! Great service and amazing food!

We held a meeting banquet on May 30 in the semi-private space and everyone was extremely pleased with the choice. The food was great, the service was attentive without being overwhelming, and the atmosphere was perfect. It was quiet enough for the conversations our groups prefer and relaxed enough that they stayed and talked into the evening. A perfect event.

I've been to The Grill on the Alley a couple of times and I've always found the food and service to be sufficient.  Food - Filet Steak Salad: is a decent size and they don't skimp on the steak, which is definitely a plus. However, the taste of the salad doesn't really sync up with the cost of this salad. - Chicken Pot Pie: is a speciality of The Grill and it is definitely worth a try.  While I've never had a bad experience at The Grill on the Alley, I wouldn't say this place is a must try (especially when you are in the downtown/ River North area).
The food is excellent and the service is great. The martini hits the spot. A terrific way to have delightful evening after a visit at 360 Chicago.
Great location, classic but inventive menu, fabulous service. This place has everything you need for a great dinner in Chicago. Make a reservation!

Never heard of it, but I've become a fan of trying new. I had the white fish and it was very good and flaky. My boyfriend had the fish and chips and said it was alright. The best part was our drinks, I had the cucumber martini A++++++ I will return and try other things. The reason for 4 stars is the service was a bit sluggish and they seemed more attentive to larger tables who would have bigger billls.
Pricey but delicious burgers & salads.  Pepper Bacon Cheeseburger was huge.  Choose the peanut cole slaw for the side.  Clubby atmosphere & good service, but a lot to spend for basic meal.

This place was absolutely amazing! The servers are very courteous and helpful in picking out a wine from their very large selection, and even let us try a sample of a wine we were interested in. The food was also outstanding, and definitely leaves you feeling full. The decor also adds to an overall beautiful experience.
just a quick drink while we were waiting for our group to join us. Service was quick, Drink were stiff. Menu looks good, we just decided to eat somewhere else.

I almost gave this place only two stars but decided the food really was good enough to pull it up a bit. It really was very tasty. The wine list is extensive and as affordable or expensive as your pocketbook allows you to go. I love lobster bisque and while I've had better, it was very good here. The rib-eye steak and prime rib my boyfriend and I ordered were both delicious and perfectly cooked, and I would definitely recommend the creamed spinach side dish and the peach cobbler. The atmosphere was very classic and lovely, exactly what I wanted for a Christmas Eve date. But some things were just not up to my expectations for a fine dining establishment. The menu was cluttered and used very tiny print so as to force everything onto a single legal-sized page. There were also not nearly as many options for steak as I expected from the name of the place. Finally the service was down-right 'meh,' for this style of restaurant. The server was not welcoming or warm, it seemed like he just wanted to get his job done. It took forever for our starting drinks to arrive and the server looked absolutely baffled by the fact I wanted my wine to arrive with my meal instead of immediately. And then it was a good five minutes after our food arrived before my wine got there! We asked a lot of questions(there wasn't room on the busy menu to describe many of the dishes), and our server answered them briefly with little detail and offered few, if any, recommendations. He was also very slow about refilling our waters and removing empty glasses and dishes from the table. Finally, my boyfriend ordered a coffee to wait while I had dessert because he isn't into sweets, and it also didn't arrive until I was almost finished with the cobbler. I only go to fine dining restaurants like this for special occasions, and I expect the service to be as wonderful as the meal itself so that the whole experience makes the occasion even more special. The service here just fell flat and was very disappointing.

The bartenders there are top notch. Neph and his co-workers are very attentive, and really do a great job. The lobster Cobb when its on the menu, is awesome, and the plank salmon with spinach is one of my favorites for sure. A+
i used up my sodium intake for the whole january. everything is too salty. i will never come to this restaurany again
Breakfast service was terrible!  Took 15 minutes to get coffee alone - usually great service, we had a young girl who was inattentive.  Will come back - but will ask NOT to have her as our server.

I recently held a dinner for 23 in a private room at this restaurant. I cannot say enough good things about the food, the wine, the staff and Dennis Neuzil, the event manager. They helped to create a great and memorable dinner for all of my guests and can't wait to return to do it again.
When here while I was on vacation and Enough said, Best Chicken Pot Pie EVER!! Oh and they make a killer Pomegranate Patron Margarita!
Everything is amazing but try the short ribs and the chicken pot pie. It's always easy to get a table here and the dining rooms are beautiful. You definitely can't go wrong here...highly recommended.

I stop by The Grill on the Alley after work from time to time and I am always impressed with the staff. They are super friendly and always seem to remember me. I sit at the bar often and the atmosphere is great. I have eaten at the bar and the food has always been top notch. Terrific neighborhood find.

Very cool atmosphere - always dig the white jacketed waiters. have only been here for lunch. the lobster bisque is very good - heavy heavy on the cream. everything else is very simply mediocre...at best. worth a visit but that's probably about it.
It was ok but I had to hunt for the bartender to pay the bill, it took forever and the place was not busy.
Exactly what I should have expected for a hotel restaurant. Overpriced food that was underwhelming. My beef short ribs were bland and fatty. But, the service was good.
Great salads and steak but my short ribs were a bit fatty.  Overall, great ambiance for a quiet evening

Oh my goodness this place is good.  Went here two days in a row for lunch.  Not only were the Tigers staying in the Westin hotel where the place is right next to, the crowd wasn't too bad in the bar area.  Being the lush that I am, I drank a top shelf margarita and a ruby red grapefruit martini.  Both delicious and made with freshly squeezed juice.  The bartender/server was very nice and knowledgeable about the menu and our random Chicago questions.  I got the California turkey sandwich which I would highly recommend: real turkey with a sweet tomato chutney.  Didn't even need mayo.  Will definitely take my husband back here when we go to Chicago again :)
Overpriced hotel food. Not creative at all. Standard items. Doesn't make sense to go there when there are great restaurants in area that are far better.

My husband and I went here for my 30th birthday. It is definitely a fancy place- right across the street from the Water Tower and Hancock building, so there is no parking. We ended up taking a cab, which isn't too bad since we live fairly close to downtown. Our meal was amazing; I ordered the filet mignon, and my husband did a porterhouse. The waiter was very knowledgeable and friendly. Overall, we had a great time. This is definitely a place for special occasions. I only gave it a four because our side dishes were a little on the small side compared to other fancy restaurants- although the mac n cheese I had was delish.

We went here on a Thurday evening for some drinks. Good service & strong cocktails. We ended up back here Sunday afternoon for lunch & the food was delicious! VERY large portions too. A bit pricey, but it is Chicago.
We went for lunch .. crabcake sandwiches ... very delicious. Later in the evenings we went for drinks. They even check out recipes for you to make the drink you want. Great atmsophere.

I live in the neighborhood and love the restaurants around here.  I have been to this restaurant many times and the last two have had incredibly slow service.  After my experience at lunch time today I will not be heading back here probably ever.  The service was incredibly slow - we finally got our drinks as we were halfway through our meal.  My hamburger was overcooked and it oddly enough comes with thousand island dressing which I asked to have eliminated and of course my burger came with it.  It is unfortunate to have this restaurant in such a high tourist area as it does not speak well for a city that is blessed with wonderful restaurants where food and service join together to provide a wonderful experience.  And by the way, there are many such restaurants within close proximity to this one.

Went to The Grill on the Alley twice on my visit to Chicago. The first time because its connected to my hotel and convenient, but the second time was because of the experience from the first visit!  We sat at the bar and the service was fantastic!  The cocktails were AMAZING!!  We had the Grapefruit Martini and I think this is my new favorite cocktail. So refreshing with the fresh squeezed Ruby Red Grapefruit juice.  All the servers were so nice and helpful when I first arrived, explaining all the different beverages.  Their service never did fail me. Even on the second night, the bartender greeted us with a "Nice to see you again" and both nights this place was packed.  I can't comment on the food but what i saw looked so good. Will definitely return here on my next Chicago trip!

We had a delicious Valentine's meal here and my food was amazing.  First, the Wild Berry Mojito:  EXCELLENT drink.  I think this is my favorite drink next to the kiwi mojito that I have had at Fogo de Chao.  It is just amazing and i love slurping up the crushed fruit at the bottom.  Some places have really gross hard fruits at the bottom but you can tell at Grill on the Alley and Fogo that the fruit is fresh and the drinks are just soo amazing.  I guess its rude digging the fruit out with my straw and slurping it up but it is worth it. I had Ahi Tuna Sashimi for appetizer which was surprisingly generously portioned.  I was expecting the typical fancy restaurant thing where you get 3 tiny pieces on a tiny plate, but this was large.  It also came with this scrunched up, salted kale - which I had never had before but it tasted amazing like a mix between salted seaweed and popcorn.  And I had some bites of boyfriendts lobster bisque.  Ahhhh, so good. Then, the most amazing part of the mealS  Pork chop with blackberry sauce!!!  This dish was HEAVEN.  Just each part was really outstanding - the tender juicy meat, the succulent but not-too-sweet blackberry sauce, portion size, temperature, etc.  Amazing.  And it came with a generous helping of garlic mashed potatoes.  I couldntt finish it all and had an amazing breakfast the next morning as well. The dining experience here was pretty perfect - great food, friendly service, real classy ambiance and the food came out quickly.  The bathroom was a little bizarre and through this little maze in some back area of the restaurant.  But that is a minor complaint.  And walking here from our hotel was perfect for Valentines Day because Michigan Avenue still had Christmas lights up and it was a very romantic feel.  Definitely recommend this restaurant for a special occasion!
took an hour for food to arrive and it wasn't even that busy.  never again.  food wasnt very good either.
Best pork chop. EVER!

Third visit in a year.  I typically stay in the Westin, and The Grill is in the Westin lobby.  Had the burger the first two times, and the Chicken Cobb sandwich today.  Burger is huge and delicious.  Cobb was... Ok.  Too big, but because it had half a head of lettuce on it, and not enough chicken.  The avocado was delicious.  Basically a Cobb salad on bread, I guess.  Service has always been outstanding, but then again, I sit at the bar.  Great, and reasonably priced, wine list (and I'm big into wine).  Nice  old-school bar and restaurant.  Manly without being pretentious, two flat screens showing the news or ESPN, and the walls are covered with funky portraits, mostly pen and ink.  I will continue to dine here at least once every time I visits Chicago.  See you in two weeks...
The food is good and generous portions.  A little overpriced for the environment.  But overall, a cozy nice place.

My sister treated me for Christmas Day dinner at  8:00 PM.  You get to pick out from limited menus from there dinner choice's. So first course I had Endive Salad w/ Spicy nuts & Gorgonzola Cheese. Susan Choice was Jumbo Lump Crab cake w/ Beurre Blanc Sauce. Entree : My choice Roasted  Australian Rack of Lamb in a Marsala Mint sauce w/ Spinach Yukon Mashed potatoes. Susan choice Double Cut Pork Chop in a Port Wine Blackberry Sauce w/ Spinach Mashed Potatoes & Green Beans. They had to take my plate back because when I cut into it it was so pink like a rose. I wanted it brown on the inside. A bartender in our hotel said I should of asked for it to be butterflied . But our waiter felt bad that the The Grill paid for my dessert & latte . Dessert I had Key Lime Pie & Susan had Fruit cobbler w/ ice cream in came in the shape a small boat. very good food. Susan had left over's her mashed potatoes . I ate everything and still had room for desert.  Our waiter was very nice.  My sister pointed out that I was using the wrong fork for our first course. Most fork look alike , I prefer to use the smallest of the forks at home. But it's different when you are fine dinning. It was semi dark  lighting easy on the eyes but not as loud in most places.

We went to The Grill for my birthday dinner last night and had a wonderful experience! The restaurant was very elegant and romantic. I loved the ceiling lights with the shadows of people dancing/playing music. It is this kind of detail that I enjoy discovering!  I cannot say enough great things about the service! Our waitress was friendly and helpful in choosing wine. When my boyfriend mentioned that it was my birthday to the chef, who was visiting guest tables, he gave me some recommendations. Chef Jorge Alvarez was right on target with his steak suggestions! My rib-eye was deliciously juicy and huge! I will probably be eating steak leftovers all week. We ended the night with a brownie a la mode topped with fudge, caramel, and pecans. The personalized attention from the chef and the charming atmosphere really made my birthday special!

One of my favorite places to eat in Chicago! While the waitstaff can be hit or miss, the food is always consistently fantastic. Great streak, nice martini and wine list as well. I love the location as it is conveniently located on the Mag Mile. My favorite is the double cut pork chop with blueberry sauce and sauteed apples and onions. AMAZING fruit cobblers as well :) ! To the person who commented on the bathroom situation and having to go into the hotel- the restaurant is located IN the lobby of the Westin, so it's not an inconvenience.

A sampling at the recent Chicago Food Bank Charity dinner at the Hiltion revealed some truly delightful offerings.  Steak tartare on Crostini was a tasty starter, but the highlight were the pan seared scallops with lemon butter sauce served on a small bed of spinach and crimini. When taking into the account the less than ideal cooking conditions at the show, the offerings were spectacular.  A constant queue formed at their station the entire evening.   The only reason I don't give it 5 full stars is because we have yet to eat at the actual restaurant. We look forward to experiencing the actual site soon!

The dining room is very nice, the bar is way too noisy to hold any type of conversation. The food was very good. My steak was cooked to perfection, was the perfect size (8  oz) and tasted delicious.  The side of grilled vegetables was less than what i hoped, as I thought they were garnishments as opposed to a side dish. Next time i'll opt for the fries. Overall i thought it was a good dinner. Very pricey but good.

Everything about the food was outstanding, but the indoor atmosphere is something to note. It's dark and VERY quite. I would be interested in sitting outside sometime. Definitely worth trying if you like steak; the steak and bleu cheese was absolutely amazing. You can also bring your own wine for a small corkage fee which is always a plus!

When booking your reservation be sure to ask for Ash's table.  He is an amazing waiter.  I really enjoyed the ambiance and comfortable big booths.  The food flavor was good...a pork chop in a berry sauce with mashed potatoes mixed with garlic and spinach...so yummy!  However the pork chopped was over cooked a bit which made it a bit dry.  Even though Ash wanted to raise this issue with the manager, I decided to enjoy what I already had.   The cobbler dessert is delicious (cherry) and big enough for 2-3 people.  I just wish they served a more premium ice cream to go along with it.  The vanilla ice cream they serve is just ok.  A great experience overall and recommended.

Mediocre over priced food poisoning that kept me up half the night. What more can I say about this joke of a restaurant? Stay away! Eat at home and save yourself from a bowl full of bowel grief! How can a restaurant at a Westin be so pathetically poor? Hey, corporate please wake up and fix this awful dive experience.

The food was good but the waiter was too pushy trying to get us to order everything under the sun. He must have asked 5 times to order a side of potatoes but no one wanted potatoes. I could tell you about the food we ordered which was good but the service was too much and too pushy.  I am from Los Angeles and love The Grill in the Alley in Beverly Hills but they are not aggressive and inconsiderate. I didn't like it at all and it ruined my dining experience.  As it is with bottles of wine, appetizers and steaks the bill is going to be hefty so I don't understand why the waiter wouldn't back off.  It's a shame. Whenever I find a place that I consider reliable I like going back as a safe place when I'm on the road which is what I have always considered The Grill on the Alley. Now no more. I'm done.

The grill on the alley?  More like the alley with a grill dumped in it.  Very loud, very crowded.  It's a cross between a dark train terminal and the concession stand at Comiskey Park.  The wait staff are ok.  But only go if you don't want to hear anyone or anything, and love crowds.  So small and crowded they forgo a bathroom and send you to the Westin next door!   Not good for food.  Pricey for drinks.

As an expensive steak restaurant, this was a disappointment. Entrees were scallops - nicely cooked but possibly too salty - and tuna tartare with avocado, mango and various sauces and aiolis, which was fairly tasty but smelled very strongly of fish, which in my experience is often a hint that the fish isn't fresh. The steaks themselves were very nice, slightly undercooked from what was ordered, but then served with lots of garnish that might've been better left off. The mushroom side came in some kind of tangy/acrid sauce which was simply awful. I explained to a disappointed-looking server that it "wasn't to my taste", but had my partner taste it and she also looked like she wanted to spit it out, so wasn't just me. The salad was bland, and the dessert (brownie with caramel and vanilla ice cream) merely okay. For the price ($160 for two), I've eaten meals that have blown me away with service that's been consistently five-star, so I was very disappointed.

I booked three meetings here for my company. The Grill was extremely easy to work with and very quick to respond to all my requests. They made booking easy, and easy to do remotely. I didn't attend the meeting, my colleague did, and she said everything went smoothly and our clients were VERY impressed! It is going on our list of good "working lunch" restaurants in Chicago!

This restaurant was very good. The service was fabulous. Everything came very quickly and it was a Saturday night dinner at 7pm. I have two kids 12 and 9 and it was very appropriate for kids. The restaurant has a nice "hustle-bustle" feel to it without being too loud. Ambience is low lit with gallery walls of interesting art. Quality kids menu with fish and chips and mini burgers with fresh made French fries. I had the whitefish and asparagus which was prepared very well. My only drawback would be the price. I don't mind paying a lot for dinner but the food needs to be WOW. This food was good, but nothing particularly unique.

We came here for two reasons:  The "Places" app showed it as nearby to where we were, and we were really intrigued by the contradictory one bad review we read, compared to the stellar pictures and menu we saw on the Droid app.  So, we decided to walk over to review it ourselves. Were told self seating nearly immediately.  We sat in the dining area (not the main lounge).  It was the perfect blend of busy, but not obnoxious.   Matt was our server, Dennis our bus boy.  Matt was incredible at picking out selections.  Steak tartare and tuna sashimi were wonderful selections.  We chose a white and red glass of wine.  Both of our appetizers were very well porportioned.  Not only that, they were cooked PERFECTLY.   Matt was so helpful and sweet, offering conversation when appropriate.   Overall, stellar experience.  Yes, I will drop by here again, and recommend it to others.

Spent the weekend at the Westin Hotel and loved The Grill in the Alley bar located just off the lobby! Upon arrival at the hotel, we stopped in the bar for a drink. They had high top tables and seating at the bar. We were promptly greeted at the table and ordered our martinis. Just have to say that the pink grapefruit martini with sugared rim was outstanding!! Loved the old Chicago ambiance-low lighting, walls completely covered with photos, and overhead beige-colored glass lighting fixtures with sketches emblazed on them. The next day we enjoyed wonderful appetizers-spinach artichoke dip was absolutely the best I've ever had, served with seasoned small slices of toast. We also had the Mahi-Mahi appetizer (sooo gourmet!).
Ahi tuna tartare is excellent. Steak was perfectly cooked. Great wine by the glass selections. Friendly service. Great buzz. Conveniently located in the Westin hotel.

We went to the Grill on my bf's mom's recommendation and if there's anything she knows is food!  The Grill did not disappoint us!!  We split the Cobb Omelet which was delicious and big enough for 2 along with the potatoes also yummy!  The omelet had chicken, avocado, and salsa  We wanted to try the blueberry pancakes but truthfully the omelet was more than enough for us!  The OJ was freshly squeezed and worth the $5 price!   The place itself is very fancy and beautiful and it's in a very nice part of town.

Very nice place to eat for dinner. We just walked in from a day of shopping with no reservation and was able to sit down in an out cove area. The area was waited on by the hostess staff and they where very quick to wait on you.   The food was great as well as the service.  F.Y.I. For allergy alert people they have a separate menu

Very disappointed with the service by both the host and our server for a restaurant like this.  Host just put the menus on our table before we were seated, walked away as quickly as he could, and at that time, the restaurant was not busy (11:20 AM).  Poor service by our server as well.  Neither suggested a daily special or even told us what the soup of the day was.   The food was good for lunch, but a restaurant like this needs to improve its service.

I love the food here...they have the best cobb and ahi tuna salad but I wouldnt' recommend going there if you expect fast service. My husband and I went last night,and our dinner lasted for 2 hours and 40 minutes...the service was terrible..our waiter disappeared for about 45 minutes after giving us bread.... I wish the service could match up the food....

We went in a party of 4 on a not very busy Friday night - the bar was busy but the dining areas were about 3/4 full. It was my first time at The Grill.   The experience was marred by sub-standard service for a downtown hotel charging top prices.  It took too long to get our cocktail order, and after the boast on the menu claiming "hand-crafted cocktails," I was expecting a super-looking world-class Old Fashioned.  What I got was an inferior Old Fashioned - not even average, with NO fruit -- not even a cherry that one would get in a neighborhood bar.  I remarked on this to our waiter.  Did he return to the bar to at least bring a cherry?  He did not.  The first round of drinks for people who then joined us was also very late, although the waiter explained he had spilled all the drinks, which can happen to anyone.  When the soup course arrived (a decent lobster bisque for $8), we were not given spoons.  The spoons arived a bit later, and they weren't even soup spoons!  What??  Then after-dinner coffee arrived, again with no spoons.  I would have thought it was our waiter's first night, except he seemed experienced enough.  The food at least was good -- my friends chop looked great, I had the prime rib quesadillas, which were excellent.  My friend reported that her crab cake was very good.  So...overall the dining experience was marred by slow service, a poorly made (hand-crafted) cocktail poorly presented, and an apparent shortage of cutlery in the kitchen.

i came here for lunch. we had excellent service, but i was expecting to be blown away with their food. strawberry lemonade - good and tart gazpacho - very acidic and not good in my opinion. there are pieces of onion that are kinda sharp and the avocado was not enough to calm it down. i should have went with the lobster bisque, but i wasn't near a computer to check out what yelp said =(

The food here is good, but I wasn't blown away. I think everything is a bit over-priced. Then again this place is located in downtown Chicago on the Mag Mile. I went once for lunch and got a HUGE burger. I could barely eat half, let alone finish it.  Later that week I went there again for dinner and had a pretty good prime rib quesadilla with rice and black beans. The black beans had an almost sweet flavor, and I thought that was odd... The bar seems to be the best place. It's not too busy during the top of the week, but plenty busy on a Friday night.

I went here last year during a weeklong jaunt to Chicago. We chose this place randomly, mostly because of the fact that it was located so close to our hotel (The Drake). Everything was good, but the most memorable dish was the Spinach Artichoke Dip with Grilled Crostini. I consider myself something of a spinach artichoke dip connoisseur (if there is such a thing) and The Grill's version is one of the best I've ever had (large chunks of artichoke, gooey and crispy cheese, and perfectly crunchy crostini). Definitely worth revisiting!

Came here over the weekend... Pretty standard everything... Lober bisque only outdone by Ruth Chris which is saying a lot. Seriously, order it!  **Strong drinks a hugh plus.  Nice layout, very relaxed place to sit after shopping/before your night gets started.  Great location for people visiting from out of town.. Will be back!

I have dined at the locations in Beverly Hills and San Jose. This restaurant serves the same quality of food and drink as you would expect from The Grill on the Alley so it did not disappoint. I had a perfectly prepared filet mignon covered with Blue Cheese with mashed potatoes. Great wine selection with good service.
great service, by denny, good food and location.

Very friendly bartenders and delicious pecan fudge sundae..we need to come again to have lunch or dinner sometime.   Its very spacious and we were seated right away.  We came in since our movie started later than we thought and needed to kill sometime...we regret not eating there since the menu looked good with reasonable prices

What a disappointment. For a fine dining restaurant attached ti the Westin hotel to serve mediocre food is just wrong. No lobster or crab legs on tge menu either. The Crab cakes smelled fishy. It's no wonder the place was almost empty at 8 pm. Never again

I'm usually underwhelmed by hotel restaurants but this place is delcious! I had a petit filet which was cooked and seasoned perfectly. Nice wine list and delicious brownie sundae! You might want to bring a companion though. I was travelling for business and ordered the sundae with good intentions of just a few bites. Pretty soon there was nothing but a lone pecan floating around my dish. I'll just pretend there were no calories in that. Yum

We had dinner here on Saturday. The food was good quality and the waiter extremely attentive. In addition to the appetizer of salad and fried calamari, the two of us enjoyed a filet mignon, and a broiled lake superior white fish. I was surprised by the lack of patrons in the restaurant on a Saturday night. The place was only 50% full and most people were at the bar. So the atmosphere of the dinner suffered from all the empty tables. The clientele was also an older crowd.

Having worked at Marshall Field's - Water Tower for four years (sadly, it's now Macy's), I can honestly say I have been to "The Grill" dozens of times.  From their full liquor, beer, and wine selections to their wonderful lunch and dinner menus, "The Grill" has yet to disappoint me.  My favorite dishes are: Appetizer - Popcorn shrimp with spicy chipotle ranch dipping sauce. Soup - Lobster bisque. Lunch Entree - Meatloaf with mashed potatoes and sauteed spinach. Dinner Entree - Prime rib with grilled asparagus. After reading other reviews on The Grill on the Alley, I have noticed a trend.  Either the reviewers really liked this restaurant or they only stopped in for a burger or appetizer.  I have to give this restaurant the rating it deserves... a 4/5.

This is my second time dining at this location and the convenience factor helps when I'm in Chicago (location to my conference is ideal).  The bread is my favorite part of the meal!! I ordered the cream of mushroom soup and it was really good, full of mushroom flavor. My colleague ordered the oysters of which I had one- yummy!! The lime chicken salad was exactly what you would expect. I asked for added red peppers and tomatoes and I was accommodated nicely.  Oddly, our server overcharged our bill by about $20, which I caught and it was handled professionally. The menu is slightly overpriced, but the Grill is located inside a hotel (Westin) so expected. $3.50 for a soda is a bit steep regardless, right?? Last little thing...the table water tasted very bad.

Go here for brunch.  Just do it.  You'll thank me later. We were on a hunt for a brunch.  This place appeared open.  It looked fancy.  We didn't care, we were hungry.  We were seated in the back.  Our service was prompt. Our server took our order.  He returned with coffee to be left at the table.  Win.  I like when they leave me coffee.  We ordered a Denver Omelet and a Belgian Waffle.  We informed the waiter we planned on sharing, thinking he would bring us an extra plate.  It took all of ten minutes to get our food.  They brought out two small omelets for us, and one huge Belgian waffle.  We were afraid we were going to get charged twice for the omelets.  But the kitchen was nice enough to split it on two plates, and we each got our own. The eggs were perfectly fluffy.  The peppers, cheese, and ham perfectly sized and awesome tasting.  The fresh fruit on the side was exactly that.  So fresh, I wonder where they get fruit that good from in the middle of winter!  The Belgian Waffle, oh, I think this might be the best Belgian waffle I've ever eaten.  It was perfectly crispy on the outside, and cooked just to the right amount of done-ness (not too dry, not too doughy).  The sprinkled powder sugar was just perfect too. I can't wait to go back.  This place is a hidden gem of breakfast in Chicago.

Mid west = BEEF - BEEF - more BEEF !!! We had a 8:15 reservation on a very busy Saturday night. Was seated immediately and was thanked for being on time. (a total PLUS in my book!)  They had a special prefix menu for vday but we decided that we would be happier if we just ordered what we want. So we with oysters on the half shell. They were very large and VERY fresh. The dressings and toppings were on the side and were very tasty and wanting us to want more. But we knew that we needed to save room for our meal.  As for entrees, my bf got the rib-eye on bone (med-rare) with grilled veggies with a very pungent balsamic glaze. The steak was a HUGE16oz. but the grilled veggies could have been more awesome without the glaze. I got the petite fillet Mignon (rare) with garlic spinach mashed potatoes. The mashed potatoes were good but weren't HOT. HOWEVER steaks were AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Just thinking about it is making me drool. I can't wait to go back to try other cuts. The table next to us had ordered chicken pot....no lie it was the size of a 8" apple pie. Portions are huge so come ready to eat!  We both had a great time and experience. Service was a little slow but we understood how busy it was because of the vday wknd. Its a great date place and family gathering with adult children. Not a good place for kids.

Went here for our anniversary,  It was excellent, pricing was what you expect-I feel it was a great value, server was very attentive, atmosphere was quiet, but had a good crowd.  Food was great.  Not a lot to say, we went here because I could not swing a 7:00 Friday night reservation at Gibson's the day of and I was not going to pay the absurd pricing of the Capital grill.  Overall, the experience I had here exceeded the experience of both alternatives discussed herein and my expectations.  A home-run! I agree with the other review that said that it was a hidden gem.

A couple of weeks ago I was shopping in the area with a friend. She suggested  we  stopped by for some breakfast.  We were greeted warm and graciously  by the host.  I was surprised to find a very refined restaurant serving a spectacular breakfast menu. The choices varied from omelets to steak and eggs. The service and ambiance was impressive ! I would strongly recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to be treated like a high roller on commoner's budget .  I'm looking forward to stopping by once more to try their  dinner menu, which boast 16oz prime rib to fresh seafood choices.

and godzilla smile.  come back! come back hungry man!  win/win godzilla.  Upon writing my previous review, it was not long until I was contacted by The Grill with a "your opinion matters, let's fix this" type of email. I was surprised to say the least, but as I live out of town, I politely declined the offer, but made it very clear that I would, eventually, return. Anonymously of course.  That is what I did this week, twice. Delighted to say both times were nicely done. Earlier in the week, I stopped in with the gf for the always delicious crabcake, and to give the previously inconsistent steak tartare another shot. As usual, the crabcake was spectacular. The steak tartare surpassed any previous version by a mile. It seemed a tad smaller, but the flavor and texture were spot on. Perfect service by Amanda, who also called me later that night to let me know the gf left her gloves behind. Wow! WOW! -not sure how she got my number, but what a nice thing to do. Thank you very much Ms. Amanda!  Went back last night for a prime rib sandwich and a filet. Nicely done. The filet was flavorfull as were the sides, my sandwich was a tad overdone, closer to medium than med/rare, but not enough to really matter and it was a fine piece of cow. I also had a pretty respectable Sidecar. Thank you Grill! I look forward to my next visit! Carry on.

I don't usually visit hotel bars or restaurants if I'm not staying there, but, this place is just delicious. I love the dark wood, I love the atmosphere, I love the windows, I love the staff. It's a big 'ole love fest. I mostly love their Ruby Red Lemon Drop - a lemon drop martini with FRESH GRAPEFRUIT JUICE and a sugared rim. It makes me give thanks for citrus. The bartenders are so charming, the food is delicious (tuna tartar, prime rib quesadilla, cheese selection, jumbo lump crab cake with shoestring fries, etc), the prices..a bit high, but worth it in my humble opinion. My only suggestion is that you bypass the dining room, which seems to always be sleepy, and stay in the bar.

I was supposed to meet a "gal pal" at The Grill on a recent Friday night- but after a last minute cancellation on her part- I met another friend there for dinner who lives in the area. My advice? Stay in the bar area. For it was fun, lively, had a great bartender and was seemingly a place I would want to hang out.  Unfortunately, we had a reservation in the restaurant area and once seated, I realized the error of my ways (should have gone back to the bar!).  The room we were seated in was blah. No windows, typical steak house decor and a bit of a tired feeling. Kind of like being in a banquet room at a hotel. Certainly not the lively bar area from which we had just come with it's windows facing the street and warm ambiance.  On this night- there were more staff than customers so you would have thought service should have been at an all time high. Eh . . .not so much.  Our server came over to tell us the specials of the day and then left to get our drinks. I'm not really sure where he went to get those drinks but they took forever to come up.  We decided to do a little splitting- one of us was going to have the Prix Fixe menu for $49.50 which included a starter, a main course and a dessert, while I was going to go the a la carte route and split the main course with my friend.  Up first- squash soup for my friend and a mozzarella tomato salad for me. Good, but the soup tasted a bit like pumpkin pie.  My salad was quite tasty, though.  For our entree- we split the Chilean Sea Bass which was quite good- perfectly done and with the side of mac and cheese that we ordered was more than enough food for the two of us.  Service was spotty. Our server was missing in action most of the time so we had to keep flagging down the bus staff to help us out (they were terrific!, BTW!) And just where was he getting those drinks at? I felt like I needed to order another one the second he placed a drink on the table as the lag time to the bar and back was so great!  The whole experience left me a little cold. Dinner for two even after splitting an entree came to $140 including drinks which just felt like alot of money given the experience that we had had.  And as we exited and walked back through the lively bar,and made a note of all the fun people appeared to be having- I made a mental note, that if I came back . . . . the bar was going to get my visit!
Unlike the Signature Room, we got serviced quick and food was a delight. Drinks were a plus!

This is a "hidden" gem on the Magnificent mile. It's not pretentious like four $ restaurants but their food quality is great. We tried going to a French bistro for a spur of a romantic moment but the French apparently can't pick up their phone. Then I remembered the Grill on the Alley. My mom raved about their brunch when she stayed at the Weston Hotel (The Grill is their on-site restaurant). I've had their salad for lunch years prior and remember it being expensive but good. This time we made a reservation to do a full course dinner. The atmosphere is of a timeless sports bar/club. It doesn't scream romantic but the lighting, the quietness (not many people were dining in the part we were in) and the attentiveness of the waiter made our night.  The server was a professional, a professional waiter, how all waiters should be. He knew exactly what to say, do, didn't hover, didn't make me feel bad that I didn't order dessert.  We started with Tuna tartar and continued on with mixed green salad and tomatoes with mozzarella drizzled in Balsamic reduction, the Filet Mignon, and Grilled Sea Bass (Seafood special of the day). The tuna tartar: artistic perfection of three layers of avocado, mango and fresh tuna. The chips that came with the appetizer had the perfect amount of crunch that fared well with the softness of the avocado, mango and the tuna.  The salads were excellent. The balsamic reduction was sweet and was an amazing combination to the tenderest mozzarella I've bit into. The waiter asked if I wanted my steak medium or medium rare. This is how I know he knows what he is doing. Steaks should only be enjoyed medium or medium rare. Since you should just go to the butcher and skip the restaurant if you want to eat rare, and anything cooked beyond medium is basically horse meat. I've never had a horse, but I heard their meat is tough.  The filet mignon melted in my mouth. So juicy and tender. The Sea Bass was so juicy and flaked off with a hint of a touch. No need for lemon since the fish was fresh and almost creamy in the mouth. The sides, I had the mushroom and he had the grilled veggies, were cooked to perfection. The mushroom wasn't soggy but juicy and the grilled veggies were had the smokiness that paired well with its own juices and  balsalmic dressing.  ***In the summer months, the Grill has outdoor seating that makes a great people watching spot. Their drinks are good but don't ask the waitress for any drink recommendations. Ask the bartender!

This is now officially my favorite bar. It's not so expensive if you stick to ONE drink - quelle idee! And a charming waiter told me the deal with all the art on the wall. It seems a former art teacher framed a ton of his student's work to display here (I like my "home of a 250 year old socialite" description - but now I know what the real story is!). Even better story now - there is a wide variety of art, everything from gorgeous figure drawings, cute children's work, and a wide variety of varying degrees of talent. All beautifully framed.  This is one of four "Grills", and the most successful one - 'cos they serve breakfast! They are actually not affiliated with the Westin, but have sort of a symbiotic relationship, obviously.  I love this place. And I love that when I go here, it's probably because I'm working downtown - which is my preference too. It's friendly classy, charming and benevolently upmarket. My kinda joint!

I came here for dinner. It was very crowded but the cute waiter got me a table. Had the tuna tartare and it was delicious. The service  was great, friendly, atmosphere was lively- but a just little slow ( justified though because it was so busy). Oh and I watched some other waiter slip and crashed his tray on a patron.... Oooops!

Looking for after dinner drinks we headed here. It's the end of July and I finally had my first mojito of 2010.  And damn, it was a good one.  Their version has berries muddled with the mint.  It was truly refreshing.  I also had a pear martini, which was equally delightful. Even though we had just eaten dinner, we were still hungry.  So we nibbled on some prime rib quesadillas.  Those seriously hit the spot!  The guacamole on the side a great addition.  It was the perfect dish to share. The place was pretty empty on a recent weeknight.  Mostly just a sprinkling of tourists and business travelers.  Oh and a dude trying to pick up a girl.  Poor thing!    I think I was most impressed with the service.  Our server was excellent--attentive, but did not hover.   And when we accidentally knocked a fork off of our high top (we're a rowdy duo), another employee came over to, not only retrieve said piece of silverware, but also promptly replaced it.  All within literally 4 seconds.    I'd say The Grill is a good option for Michigan Ave dining.  Not my favorite, but with a large menu and top notch drinks, everyone is bound to find something to suit their fancy.

I love their house chardonnay, and the Chicken Marsala with garlic mashed potatoes is absolutely to die for. LOVE it!! Every time I am in town for work or fun I have to stop by and eat here. I haven't had a Chicken Marsala this good anywhere else. the BOMB i say. I could honestly not tell you about a single thing else on this menu cause I was completely won over by the chicken dish to the point that I could choose nothing else.

As others have mentioned, this is a great little steakhouse masquerading as a bar. I am staying at the Westin this week for business and decided to head down for dinner this evening. I had the Filet with Bordelaise sauce served with spinach mashed potatoes.  The steak was very tender and juicy and the mashed potatoes were perfectly moist, not the least bit dried out. I followed up dinner with a good Creme Brulee and a cup of coffee.  Their coffee is very good and served in a carafe at the table. The only lowlight was the Bloody Mary I ordered.  I ordered with Ketel and received said Bloody Mary but after taking the first sip, I noticed it tasted heavily of lime.  When I inquired with the server as to whether they had accidentally served it with a citrus vodka, I was informed it had lime juice in it.  Boy did it - it had way too much lime.  I still drank it and somewhat enjoyed it, but buyer beware - if you want a traditional bloody mary, this ain't it. Four stars for attentive service and good food, great hotel restaurant!

Very nice upscale restaurant on the ground floor of the Westin hotel right on the Magnificent Mile.  I had them make me the seared ahi appetizer into an entree size portion, which they did gladly.  They made it with more tuna and also added steamed rice to it which made it perfect.  It was delicous.  My husband had the cobb salad which was as good as it gets.  We really enjoyed our meal.

It's very sad really. This place used to feel posh and warm. It's the little things - like the cheap napkins they use now. The lame cuts of meat. The food was awful on a recent visit. And of course, the prices have actually gone up. The only reason I gave them 2 stars is because I feel sorry for the wait staff.

Love the old school decor, love the lighting, the service was great, great easy location to get to and very good American food. We went for Restaurant Week so we did get a good deal on lunch ($22 for three courses).  Started with Caesar salad (delicious and well seasoned), I had the Trout Almandine (perfect!) and my husband had the "best" skirt steak "he'd ever had."  Finished with a fruit tart a la mode, which was deliciously light.  I would love to go back here for a nice steak dinner, but I'd probably have the fish again!  It was so good.  If you're in the mood for some good basic well cooked and well seasoned American food, definitely come here!

We've been to the Grill many times, and every time we go we feel like part of the Grill Family! Last night we went for my partner's Birthday; and let me tell you that there was absolutely no doubt in my mind that it was going to be the best choice for a Birthday Dinner in the city of Chicago. Now I'm a huge food critic, and have been to many places in the city; though no place yet has made me feel as comfortable and has made a dining experience more enjoyable then the Grill. Kristen, the Evening Manager is absolutely wonderful, and our server Manfred get's funnier every time we dine.  Its comforting knowing that when we dont feel like cooking a home cooked meal at our condo that we dont have to go very far in the city to get the same feeling as we would in our own surroundings. I give this place hands down all 5 stars, and will continue to go back.

The first time I ate here, my boss and I were working an event with the hotel and we were both starving so he asked if I wanted to grab a bite. Sounds pretty good if he's paying. I ordered a blacken chicken sandwich and he got a burger. I thought the chicken was really dry but the food was free so I wasn't going to complain. The second time I ate here, I was just looking for a burger close to my office (different company, different boss). I ordered their burger and ok, yeah, it was filling but it wasn't that great. It was just okay. But again, the burger was dry.  The fries were pretty decent though because I like fries where you actually taste the potatoes. And the service was okay. Nothing particularly special about it.  I think I prefer burgers from the Mity Nice Grill on the other side of the Hancock now. Theirs is at least juicier.

Stop here when we checked in to the hotel. We had great service from Manfred, he made it memorable and made great suggestions. Food was great and I highly recommend that you order the fruit cobbler for dessert. Yummy.

A hidden little place right off the Mag Mile. However, it's no little place, they actually have two large dining areas and a bar. It's a great place to grab lunch while on a shopping trip. Food is decent, some entrees are better than others, the burgers and salads are good, the chicken pot pie is good, the mac and cheese is awesome. The pastas are not that great so I would stay away from those. For dessert, go for the strawberry shortcake. Prices in my opinion are pretty good for a restaurant right on Michigan Ave. Great place for groups and after work drinks. Service is professional and prompt.
